interestingFacts: Japan has more than 6,800 islands and is known for its bullet trains and cherry blossoms.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world and is home to about 60% of the world’s lakes.
Brazil is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese and houses the Amazon Rainforest.
India is the world's largest democracy and the birthplace of chess, yoga, and Ayurveda.
France is the most visited country in the world and home to the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre.
Australia has more kangaroos than people and is the only continent covered by a single country.
Egypt is home to the ancient pyramids and the Sphinx and is one of the oldest civilizations in the world.
Germany is known for its engineering, beer, and castles, and it has over 1,500 different types of sausages.
South Africa has three capital cities and is known for its biodiversity and cultural diversity.
Norway is known for its stunning fjords and consistently ranks among the happiest countries in the world.
